meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The plant slowly acclimatizes to the sunny weather in its new home.
meanings.sent2: She acclimatizes quickly to the cold temperatures after moving to the north.
meanings.sent3: The cat acclimatizes to the noisy city by finding a cozy spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: His mind acclimatizes to the idea of change like a ship adjusting to the waves.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's body acclimatizes to the intense training regimen, becoming stronger each day.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The puppy acclimatizes to its new home by exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: After a few days, she acclimatizes to the busy office environment.
meanings.sent3: The child acclimatizes to the idea of sharing toys with his siblings.
meanings.sent4: Her heart acclimatizes to the rhythm of the music, feeling more at ease.
meanings.sent5: The student acclimatizes to the new school schedule, finding it easier each week.
